description: Three inmates at the Tom Green County Jail have tested negative for COVID-19, the sheriff's office said Saturday.  "All test were negative and no inmates currently exhibit symptoms of COVID-19," a news release from the Tom Green Sheriff's Office states.  "TGSO Jail officials continue to work diligently to ensure the safety and welfare of inmates, staff, and the...
text:
Three inmates at the Tom Green County Jail have tested negative for COVID-19,
the sheriff's office said Saturday.

"All test were negative and no inmates currently exhibit symptoms of
COVID-19," a news release from the Tom Green Sheriff's Office states. "TGSO
Jail officials continue to work diligently to ensure the safety and welfare of
inmates, staff, and the community."

The inmates were tested after an employee tested positive for the coronavirus
last week. The inmates had exposure to the employee.

It was announced Friday that a second employee also tested positive for the
virus, but that person did not interact with inmates, the sheriff's office
said.

The city reported there are four new positive cases throughout the county on
Saturday.

The patients include:

* A woman in her 50s who had exposure to a patient.

* A teenage female who had exposure to a patient.

* A woman in her 20s who had exposure to a patient.

* A man in his 30s who hadexposure to a patient.

These bring the total number of cases linked to Tom Green County to 99 with 13
remaining active, meaning they are being monitored by health officials,
according to information provided by the city of San Angelo.

Across the state more than 1 million tests had been administered by 3:45 p.m.
Friday, according to the Texas Department of State Health Services. Of those,
61,006 returned positive for COVID-19, with 19,312 cases remaining active and
40,068 listed as recovered. Texas has attributed 1,626 deaths as being linked
to the coronavirus as of Friday afternoon.

San Angelo, TX

title: May 30 COVID-19 update: 4 new cases, inmates test negative
html:
Three inmates at the Tom Green County Jail have tested negative for COVID-19, the sheriff's office said Saturday.

"All test were negative and no inmates currently exhibit symptoms of COVID-19," a news release from the Tom Green Sheriff's Office states. "TGSO Jail officials continue to work diligently to ensure the safety and welfare of inmates, staff, and the community."

The inmates were tested after an employee tested positive for the coronavirus last week. The inmates had exposure to the employee.

It was announced Friday that a second employee also tested positive for the virus, but that person did not interact with inmates, the sheriff's office said.

The city reported there are four new positive cases throughout the county on Saturday.

The patients include:

* A woman in her 50s who had exposure to a patient.

* A teenage female who had exposure to a patient.

* A woman in her 20s who had exposure to a patient.

* A man in his 30s who hadexposure to a patient.

These bring the total number of cases linked to Tom Green County to 99 with 13 remaining active, meaning they are being monitored by health officials, according to information provided by the city of San Angelo.

Across the state more than 1 million tests had been administered by 3:45 p.m. Friday, according to the Texas Department of State Health Services. Of those, 61,006 returned positive for COVID-19, with 19,312 cases remaining active and 40,068 listed as recovered. Texas has attributed 1,626 deaths as being linked to the coronavirus as of Friday afternoon.

San Angelo, TX
